{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3560971,"name":"","username":"Sean7183","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b19c9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T19:34:08.352Z","cooked":"

We are experiencing an issue with our drivetrain while the elevator is lowering back to its home position after scoring. The robot is fully controllable while the elevator is raising and scoring, but once it begins to lower, we lose control of the drivetrain. The robot takes the last input from the sticks it got before the elevator began to lower and continues to move with those until the elevator returns to home. For example, if the driver was holding backwards on the sticks while the elevator began to lower, the robot drives backwards until the elevator returns to its lowest position regardless of the actual driver input.

Any idea why this could be? We haven’t seen an apparent reason why it happens in the code. We attempted moving the elevator motors to the rio canbus and leaving the drivetrain motors on our canivore bus, but that didn’t change anything.

our current robot code: https://github.com/warroboticss/Fluke2025/tree/new
